text.0: thy raptures ever were for all mens profit so evermore have been thine earthly riches.
text.1: thou still hast been the dealerforth of vigour since among gods thou hast had power and godhead.
text.2: men have obtained his strength by sacrificing and ever urged him on to hero valour.
text.3: for the reinseizing the impetuous charger they furnished power even for vṛtras slaughter.
text.4: associate with him as teams of horses help manly might and vigour follow indra.
text.5: as rivers reach the sea so strong with praises our holy songs reach him the comprehensive.
text.6: lauded by us let flow the spring o indra of excellent and brightlyshining riches.
text.7: for thou art lord of men without an equal of all the world thou art the only sovran.
text.8: hear what thou mayst hear thou who fain for worship as heaven girds earth guardest thy servants treasure.
text.9: tlat thou mayst be our own joying in power famed through thy might in every generation.
